page.title: 16THE CHANCE INN
page.content: The hotel in Inverkeilor main street is called "The Chance Inn". This was once a coaching inn and you can still see the low archway where the horses and carriages would have gone through. Strangely enough, this is not the first "Chance Inn". The first hostelry of that name was located approximately 1 kilometre to the south on what is now a country side road. This had originally been the main road between Dundee and Aberdeen, but when a new road was constructed, (on the same line as the main road today) then the inn was also moved, so as not to lose its trade. Soon the main road will be shifted again when the new by-pass is built. Will there then be a third "Chance Inn"?
